articles.title: 15th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Far Eastern Region of Russia Feted
articles.content:
15th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Far Eastern Region of Russia Feted
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association hosted a reception at Okryu Restaurant on Wednesday to mark the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to the Far Eastern Region of the Russian Federation.
					 Present there on invitation were Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 On hand were Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Sin Hong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Iranian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Iranian President
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a message of greeting from Hassan Rouhani, president of Iran, on September 18.
					 The Iranian president in the message extended his heartfelt congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on the occasion of September 9, the birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 He hoped that the bilateral relations would favorably develop in all fields through cooperation and joint efforts of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and success in his work and the people of the DPRK prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK Taekwon-Do Players Win 13 Gold Medals in On-going Taekwon-Do World Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Taekwon-Do Players Win 13 Gold Medals in On-going Taekwon-Do World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships is going on at the Taekwon-Do Hall in Pyongyang.
					 The DPRK players won 13 gold medals in men's and women's individual pattern (1st degree-4th degree) and team pattern competitions and individual sparring matches of various weights on Monday and Tuesday.
					
					 Following are the medal standings.
					
					 Standings (country, gold, silver, bronze)
					
					 1. DPRK: 13 6 2
					
					 2. Russia: 4 9 7
					
					 3. Ukraine: 1 0 4
					
					    Bulgaria: 1 0 4
					
					 4. Czech Republic: 0 1 5
					
					 5. China: 0 1 4
					
					 6. England: 0 1 3
					
					 7. Cambodia: 0 1 1
					
					 8. Estonia: 0 0 3
					
					 9. Bosnia-Herzegovina: 0 0 2
					
					 10.  Kazakhstan: 0 0 1
					
					   India: 0 0 1
					
					   Wales: 0 0 1
					
					 The championships will go on until Thursday.

articles.title: Third-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
articles.content:
Third-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Events of the 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships are going on.
					 Working people of all strata and students and youths in Pyongyang city, Taekwon-Do fans and foreign guests watched sparring matches, demonstrations, special techniques and self-defense matches at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Wednesday.
					
					 The following are the results of the second-day events of the championships held on Tuesday:
					
					 
					
					 Men's individual 71kg sparring match
					
					1. Sergey Arakelyan (Russia)
					
					2. Dmitrii Simakov (Russia)
					
					3. Dmytro Vikhrov (Ukraine), Srdan Draskic (Bosnia and Herzegovina)
						
					
					 Men's individual 78kg sparring match
					
					1. Andrii Klymenko (Ukraine)
					
					2. Ri Song Hun (DPRK)
					
					3. Rami Shau (Bulgaria), Novak Jiri (Czech Republic)
						
					
					 Men's individual 85kg sparring match
					
					1. Andrei Kress (Russia)
					
					2. Nikita Mikhailov (Russia)
					
					3. Ham Chung Ryol (DPRK), Dmytro Pilinkevych (Ukraine)
						
					
					 Men's individual above 85kg sparring match
					
					1. Nikolay Petkov (Bulgaria)
					
					2. Rim Wi Sok (DPRK) 
					
					3. Denis Martsevich (Russia), Oleksii Danshyn (Ukraine)
						
					
					 Women's individual 57kg sparring match
					
					1. Olga Levina (Russia)
					
					2. Nailia Sadieva (Russia)
					
					3. Kim Hyang Sim (DPRK), Albena Sitnilska (Bulgaria)
					
					
					
					 Women's individual 63kg sparring match
					
					1. Pak Mi Hyang (DPRK)
					
					2. Olga Gribanova (Russia)
					
					3. Anastasia Kosteletskaya (Russia), Olga Borisenko (Estonia)
						
					
					 Women's individual 69kg sparring match
					
					1. Sin Jong Hwa (DPRK) 
					
					2. Ham Su Gyong (DPRK)
					
					3. Moskaleva Anastasiia (Russia), Zhuldyz Kabdylrakhmetova (Kazakhstan)
						
					
					 Women's individual 75kg sparring match
					
					1. Kim Su Ryon (DPRK)
					
					2. Kokasova Veronika (Czech Republic)
					
					3. Natalie Christina Buchin (England), Amy Burgess (England)
					
					 
					
					Women's individual above 75kg sparring match 
					
					1. Choe Su Ryon (DPRK)
					
					2. Elizaveta Pronchatova (Russia) 
					
					3. Stekerova Tereza (Czech Republic), Ros Sreynich (Cambodia).

articles.title: DPRK Women's Team Secures Berths in Finals of 2017 AFC U-16 Women's Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Team Secures Berths in Finals of 2017 AFC U-16 Women's Championship
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK women's team secured berths in the finals of the 2017 AFC U-16 Women's Championship started in Thailand on September 10. It belongs to Group B of league matches.
					 It beat its Chinese rival 1:0 in the semi-finals on September 20 and thus was qualified for the 2018 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup.
					
					 It is to play the finals with its south Korean rival on Sept. 23.

articles.title: Mural Tomb Dating Back to Koguryo Kingdom Unearthed
articles.content:
Mural Tomb Dating Back to Koguryo Kingdom Unearthed
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Another mural tomb dating back to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668) was recently unearthed in Posong-ri, Raknang District of Pyongyang.
					 It is an earthen tomb, which has a stone chamber under the ground. The tomb chamber is 300 cm long, 268 cm wide and 184 cm high.
					
					 Its floor was plastered with lime and paved with bricks and then plastered with lime again. And the walls were built by stones, which were plastered by lime. There are mural paintings drawn with black paint on the three walls of the north, east and west.
					
					 In the north walls there is a painting showing a wagon seemed to be one of the hero of the tomb and his wife and soldiers holding spears lined up and down.
					
					 Three-column ranks of cavaliers are represented on the eastern walls and a horse galloping toward the north and building on the western wall.
					
					 Discovered in the tomb were golden things and bells, silver nail and other gold-silver ornaments, bowls, pots and other earthenware and bone-made ornaments and other relics.
					
					 The tomb is believed to have been built in the first half of the third century in view of the structural formation and contents of the mural paintings and relics.
					
					 Through the mural paintings it was verified that the mural paintings of Koguryo Kingdom had been developed to colored ones from the process of single-black color ones.

articles.title: New Technology for Removing Soil Contamination Developed
articles.content:
New Technology for Removing Soil Contamination Developed
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The environment protection field of the DPRK is working hard to attain the state environment protection standard in concentration of domestic sewage, dust and gas leak and improve major environment economic indices in conformity with the global trends.
					 Recently, the Global Environment Science Faculty of Kim Il Sung University scientifically proved the effectiveness of mustard, sunflower and other plants in removing pollutants and developed a new technology for removing soil contamination.
					
					 The application of the new technology proved that it helps prevent pollution, protect land and remarkably increase grain production even in the soil containing many metals.
					
					 It has not impact on environment and prevents soil from being washed away. This new technology is popular among many units for its economic interests.

articles.title: Art Performance Encourages People of Kangwon Province
articles.content:
Art Performance Encourages People of Kangwon Province
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Performance of the Moranbong Band, the State Merited Chorus and the Wangjaesan Art Troupe has been given at the Songdowon Youth Open-Air Theatre in Wonsan City, Kangwon Province, the DPRK, evoking a lively response among the people of the province.
					 Om Yong Hak, manager of the Chonnaeri Cement Factory, told KCNA:
					
					 It is a unique and dynamic performance instilling into me the confidence and optimism about final victory.
					
					 As I took the road of joy and ordeals by following leader Kim Jong Il, I am determined again to implement the Workers' Party of Korea's plan of building a powerful socialist country in the death-defying spirit by upholding the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un with loyalty.
					
					 Always cherishing the honor of working at the factory associated with the leadership exploits of the Party, I will mercilessly smash the sanctions of the U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces and hasten the bright future of the powerful socialist country in the spirit of self-reliance.
					
					 Han Won Il, manager of the Wonsan Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory, said:
					
					 After seeing the performance, all the officials and workers overfulfilled their daily quota at 50 percent with conviction and optimism.
					
					 The performance encouraged us to the drive of self-reliance. It is the resolution of all our employees to greet the Conference of Mallima Frontrunners with proud labor gifts.
					
					 Yun Sin Bok, a worker of the Wonsan Fishery Station, said:
					
					 I kept in my mind the intention of the Party which made the songs of revolution and victory resound forth in Kangwon Province in the acute situation. I will believe and follow the Party only and loudly sing "Song of Big Fish Haul" the respected Supreme Leader gave me.

articles.title: Peerlessly Great Men's Loving Care for Choe Hong Hui
articles.content:
Peerlessly Great Men's Loving Care for Choe Hong Hui
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships is going on with splendor at the Taekwon-Do Hall in Pyongyang. Recently, the hall was remodeled as the center of the national martial arts thanks to the meticulous guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The Korean people recollect Choe Hong Hui, ex-president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation (ITF) who contributed to cause of Korea's reunification in the spirit of the nation, as well as Taekwon-do, orthodox martial art of the Korean nation, under the care of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 Choe had once taken the wrong way and aimed a gun at the compatriots. He was in remorse and agony while living overseas. At that time, President Kim Il Sung embraced him, taking into consideration his patriotic seed.
					
					 When Choe visited the country after naming orthodox martial art of the Korean nation Taekwon-do and founding the ITF, Kim Il Sung highly praised him, saying it was the great pride of the Korean nation that Choe developed the ITF into an organization of worldwide significance as its president.
					
					 And he clapped his hands before all others to the appearance of the Taekwon-Do program in the mass gymnastics held in celebration of the 13th World Festival of Youth and Students, and introduced Choe "the head of Taekwon-Do" to high-level guests including the head of state of other country.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il made sure that he visited the country frequently as he wanted to contribute to national reunification with Taekwon-do, encouraged him to proudly take the road of patriotism.
					
					 He had a photo session with Choe when he visited the country in October Juche 89 (2000) and met his wishes to have the headquarters of the International Martial Arts Games Committee in Pyongyang.
					
					 When Choe passed away, Kim Jong Il saw to it that a large funeral for him was held and sent a wreath to his bier, saying he took the patriotic road in his late years and that it was too natural that his remains were buried in the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery.
					
					 Indeed, Choe Hong Hui is always alive under the care of the peerlessly great men who led all members of the nation to the patriotic road for reunification with their noble idea of loving the country and nation, warm compatriotism and noble virtues.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korea Rejected by U.S. and Surrounding Countries
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korea Rejected by U.S. and Surrounding Countries
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and its vassal forces are going panic-stricken in uneasiness and horror, frightened by the DPRK's super-offensive countermeasures in succession. Under this situation south Koreans say that the present authorities are shunned by the U.S. and surrounding countries over the nuclear issue.
					 Commenting on this fact, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says:
					
					 It is natural that there is such argument in south Korea.
					
					 It is the well known fact that the U.S. has south Korea under its control, looking down upon it.
					
					 Whenever an opportunity presented itself, the U.S. praised south Korea as an "ally" and "hard-core pivot", but it was a trick to more freely use the stooge.
					
					 Tragic is that the south Korean regime has been snubbed even by surrounding countries, not to speak of the U.S.
					
					 Its authorities asserted that they would preside over the nuclear issue in cooperation with surrounding countries, vociferating about "four powers diplomacy". However, they faced a contempt and piteous ridicule as "pray among big powers".
					
					 Surrounding countries bitterly denounce the south Korean authorities' reckless THAAD deployment as it gravely threatens peace and security of not only the Korean peninsula but also Northeast Asia and they are going to take strong retaliatory steps.
					
					 After all, south Korea came to be shunned by neighboring countries as it has acted a poor colonial servant of the U.S.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Regime's Sycophantic and Treacherous Proclivity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Regime's Sycophantic and Treacherous Proclivity
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the chief executive of south Korea, met with Abe during an international meeting abroad and called for "close relations" between both sides over "ceaseless provocations by the north", asserting that it is needed to put the harshest sanctions and pressure upon the north for stop to its nuclear and missile program."
					 He also cried out for improved relations with Japan, talking about "stable management" of the past history and "forward-looking and practical exchange and cooperation".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary says that this brings to light the sinister intention to stand in confrontation with the DPRK to the last in collusion with outside forces as it reveals the inveterate sycophantic and treacherous nature of the puppet ruling forces who readily cling to sworn enemy if they could prolong their remaining days.
					
					 To invade the DPRK backed by the U.S. and Japan is a long-pursued scheme of the south Korean puppet regimes, including the present ruling quarters, it says, adding:
					
					 They are strengthening the political and military tie-ups while clinging to the coattails of the Japanese reactionaries despite disgrace. It is a treachery of hastening the formation of U.S.-led triangular military alliance and plunging south Korea into the moves for the U.S. Asia strategy and war moves against the DPRK.
					
					 No matter how eagerly they may beg the U.S. and Japan for "security," south Korea will be thrown into a miserable and pitiful position where they have to pay dearly.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should behave with discretion, mindful of the lesson that their sycophancy and collusion with outside forces will lead to a war and a miserable end will await them.

articles.title: U.S. Is Chiefly to Blame for Tension of Korean Peninsula: Newspaper
articles.content:
U.S. Is Chiefly to Blame for Tension of Korean Peninsula: Newspaper
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- It is against international law to take sanctions for retaliation and especially the sanctions for blockade against a sovereign state is an act of aggression and wanton violation of international law, Rodong Sinmun on Wednesday says in an article.
					 Under the situation where the U.S. is keeping the harshest sanctions and pressure in all fields of politics, economy and military, it is inevitable for the DPRK to take the toughest counteraction to safeguard the sovereignty of the country and the right of the people to exist, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The ICBM-ready H-bomb test of the DPRK for self-defence is legitimate and just.
					
					 No one has a legal ground for putting sanctions and pressure over this step.
					
					 Resorting to sanctions and pressure over the DPRK's righteous and self-defensive measure is an act of deliberately coiling up the situation and disturbing peace. But the U.S. and those countries pretending to be powers while subdued by the U.S. are asserting as if the UN "sanctions resolution" is needed for detente on Korean peninsula. This is no more than an excuse to justify their self-contradictory acts.
					
					 The U.S. is chiefly to blame for aggravated situation of the Korean peninsula as it has turned the peninsula to a theatre of conflicts through unprecedented anti-DPRK sanctions and pressure and ceaseless arms build-up.
					
					 It is urgent to remove the lingering attachment for military option on Korean peninsula from the minds of U.S. rulers by maintaining the practical equilibrium of force with the U.S. This is a realistic way for ensuring genuine peace and security in the peninsula and the region desired by the Korean nation and international community.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Japan's Militarist Attempt at Rearmament
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Japan's Militarist Attempt at Rearmament
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kawai, special aide for diplomacy to the president of the Japan Liberal Democratic Party, recently told reporters that it is needed to discuss the issue of arming the "Self-Defense Forces" with intermediate range ballistic missiles and cruise missiles for "peace" and "prosperity" as the DPRK and China have such weapons. 
					 In the U.S. a few days later, he had a talk with the director general of the Heritage Foundation, a policy research institute, in which he asserted the need to introduce cruise missiles into "SDF" in order to contain China.
					
					 Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says it is a revelation of the shameless aggression scheme of the Japan ultra-right forces to step up militarist rearmament by creating whatever pretexts in order to realize the ambition for overseas expansion.
					
					 Japan has long switched the direction of bolstering the military capabilities into attack-oriented and has made desperate efforts to put regional countries within its striking range, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 The "theory of threat from the DPRK" touted by the Japan ultra-right forces is just a pretext for realizing rearmament.
					
					 Whenever the DPRK took measures for self-defence to cope with the ever-increased nuclear threat and blackmail from the U.S. after the end of Cold War, the Japanese reactionary ruling quarters have vociferated about "threats", and through this have met their political and military interests.
					
					 Japan, stooge of the U.S., is making desperate efforts to opt for reinvasion by possessing strategic weapons. This points to Japan's extreme aggressive ambition for dominating Asia-Pacific.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is Japan's wild act of seeking rearmament while failing to come to its senses even though it is a war criminal state and a defeated nation.

articles.title: "Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK Is Provocation: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
"Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK Is Provocation: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. cooked up another illegal "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK at the UN Security Council. This is an open provocation to the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary.
					 It is a sheer sophism that the U.S. faulted the DPRK's H-bomb test for ICBM, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 If the nuclear test has to be faulted as claimed by the U.S., the U.S. has to be subject to sanctions. It is because the U.S. has conducted the world's greatest number of nuclear tests and it was the first country that used A-bombs and has steadily carried out nuclear tests by squandering huge funds.
					
					 The U.S. is a nuclear rogue state that deserves denunciation by the world. Such a rogue state rigged up the "sanctions resolution" while holding confabs with its followers by using its hegemonic position in the international arena. Such "sanctions resolution" can never be tolerated.
					
					 Firm is the stand of the army and people of the DPRK to keep to the path chosen by them while steadily consolidating the military attack capabilities qualitatively and quantitatively for mounting nuclear counterattack on the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK has done what it could do despite the U.S. vicious sanctions and pressure and the chauvinists' vicious obstructions.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are waiting for a moment to show the mettle of Songun Korea in the do-or-die spirit and the spirit of annihilating the enemies.
					
					 The U.S. land across the ocean can never go scot-free.

articles.title: Intention of Military Provocation of U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Forces Assailed
articles.content:
Intention of Military Provocation of U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Forces Assailed
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces have gone zealous in military provocation while talking about "regular deployment" of nuclear strategic assets of the U.S. on the Korean peninsula, introduction of weapons and "examination of redeployment of tactical nuclear weapons".
					 This is a senseless act of treachery to turn the Korean peninsula and the surrounding region into a world-wide thermo-nuclear war theatre with the backing of the U.S., says Minju Joson in a commentary Wednesday.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the U.S. seeks to hold hegemony in Asia-Pacific with the Korean peninsula as a military foothold. It is for this reason that the U.S. has deliberately escalated the situation on the Korean peninsula, categorically stemming the north and the south from opting for reconciliation and unity. It has often staged "sanctions" and "pressure" racket and cried out for "threats and provocation from the north". Herein lies the main reason why the U.S. has massively introduced aggression forces and nuclear strategic assets into the Korean peninsula and the areas around it while staging frantic war exercises to invade the DPRK together with the puppet forces.
					
					 What matters is that the situation on the peninsula gets worse due to the south Korean puppet forces' active pursuance of the U.S. dangerous criminal moves.
					
					 The puppet forces are calling for "regular deployment" of the U.S. nuclear strategic assets. This is a revelation of sordid intention to inflict a nuclear disaster on the Korean nation in collusion with the U.S. master, the sworn enemy of the nation.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that the south Korean authorities are nothing different from the group of traitor Park Geun Hye, a group of sycophantic traitors which plunged the south Korean people into misfortune and pain while inciting confrontation with the fellow countrymen under the pretext of "security" even though they pushed the situation on the Korean peninsula into the constant danger of the outbreak of a nuclear war during its stay in power as the top-class war servant of the U.S.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Bid to Act Shock Brigade for U.S. Sanctions on DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Bid to Act Shock Brigade for U.S. Sanctions on DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Much upset by the DPRK's 
					complete success in the H-bomb test for ICBM, the U.S. cooked UN "sanctions resolution" in collusion with its followers. Those of south Korean Chongwadae have become so ridiculous as to talk about "upgrading sanctions" and "new punishment".
					
					 The puppet Foreign Ministry let out thoughtless rubbish like "re-expression of strong will" and "something that should be taken seriously."
					
					 Commenting on the fact, Minju Joson Wednesday says this is a desperate struggling of a colonial stooge aimed to help the master prolong his remaining days even a bit, and it is a wild act of those senseless guys unable to understand the tremendous might of the DPRK soaring high defying sanctions.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the U.S. and its vassal forces' sanctions and pressure can never work on the DPRK and the puppet forces will find themselves deeper in the abyss of self-destruction should they come out as a shock brigade in the U.S. racket for sanctions against the DPRK, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is clear that should the south Korean authorities follow in the footsteps of the Park Geun Hye group, group of worst traitors who plunged the north-south relations into a total stalemate through one-sided policy out of extreme hostility toward the fellow countrymen in the north, they will face the miserable fate of destruction.
					
					 They should behave with discretion, clearly understanding our warning that they may lose an opportunity to deal with the DPRK once and for all and that everything will come to an end if they continue to resort to reckless acts.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Slam Puppet Regime for THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Slam Puppet Regime for THAAD Deployment 
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Organizations of south Korea, including the Songju Emergency Measure Committee for Defending Holy Land of Won Buddhism, reportedly held a rally in Sosong-ri, Chojon-myon, Songju County, North Kyongsang Province on Sept. 16 to denounce the authorities for introduction of THAAD.
					 The speakers at the rally charged that the regime, which appeared with the mind-set of candlelight holders, enforced the additional THAAD deployment, giving in to the U.S. demand and defying the demand of the people for peace.
					
					 THAAD is for the interests of the U.S. and Japan, they said, declaring that they would never stop the struggle to get it withdrawn.
					
					 Earlier, a measure committee of Songju inhabitants in Sosong-ri for withdrawal of THAAD was formed on Sept. 15.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to mark the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included celebration meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows in Mexico, Switzerland, Sweden, Norway, Iceland, Finland and Nigeria from Aug. 29 to Sept. 9.
					
					 On display at their venues were photos showing the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 And there were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu and books and photos introducing the successes registered by the army and people of the DPRK in building a socialist power and bolstering up the country's military capabilities.
					
					 Such Korean films were shown as "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity".
					
					 The chairman of the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association noted that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il founded and developed the DPRK and defended and advanced the socialist cause to victory with their unique Songun politics and that Kim Jong Un is reliably defending the country's sovereignty and dignity.
					
					 The chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee said that the DPRK was turned into a people-centered socialist state based on the Juche idea under the guidance of the great leaders and is invariably advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism despite the vicious obstructive moves of the hostile forces.
					
					 The chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association said that the DPRK gives courage and strength to the progressive people of the world standing against imperialism and loving peace.
					
					 The chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway stressed that the DPRK led by Kim Jong Un is now smashing every challenge of the U.S. imperialists and their followers.
					
					 The general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society said that the Korean people would certainly build a socialist power in the near future as it is led by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism lauded the feats of the great leaders for the foundation and development of the DPRK.
					
					 Congratulatory letters and messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events in Switzerland, Sweden, Finland and Nigeria.

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Observed by Cambodian Media
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Observed by Cambodian Media
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Cambodian media dedicated special write-ups to the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK from Aug. 30 to Sept. 9.
					 The newspaper Nokor Thom Daily in an article titled "Founder of the DPRK" illustrated with an image of President Kim Il Sung lauded the feats of the President who set forth the original idea and theory on building a state and establishing a genuine people's power.
					
					 The National Radio noted that Kim Il Sung accomplished the cause of national liberation and realized the cause of building the party, state and army in a short period and turned the DPRK into a socialist country independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence by leading the postwar reconstruction and socialist construction.
					
					 It praised the Songun exploits of leader Kim Jong Il who paid primary efforts to bolstering up the military capabilities, holding higher the banner of Songun.
					
					 Referring to the DPRK's recent successful ICBM-ready H-bomb test, AKP said:
					
					 The DPRK gained everything in the showdown with the U.S. century after century.
					
					 The world mechanical structure has been changed with the newly-emerging superpower DPRK as an axis.
					
					 Though it is not big in territory and population, the DPRK is the real superpower envied by the world.
					
					 The FM 105 conveyed in detail the nation-building exploits of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Emergence of DPRK as Nuclear Power Welcomed Abroad
articles.content:
Emergence of DPRK as Nuclear Power Welcomed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Bodies of Democratic Congo and Benin on Sept. 5 issued statements hailing the successful ICBM-ready H-bomb test in the DPRK.
					 Noting that the DPRK successfully conducted the test of H-bomb for ICBM under the Workers' Party of Korea's plan on building a strategic nuclear force, the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo and the DR Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association said in their joint statement:
					
					 The test clearly showed that the DPRK has ranked itself among the world's nuclear powers with dignity.
					
					 The DPRK's step for beefing up its nuclear force serves as a great deed which provided a firm guarantee for peace, as it is a measure for self-defense to cope with the hostile policy of the U.S. which deployed its military bases in south Korea and has posed constant nuclear threat and sanctions to the former.
					
					 We support the DPRK's legitimate steps aimed to resolutely foil all sorts of sanctions and pressure by the U.S. and its followers and defend the sovereignty and rights to existence and development.
					
					 The Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said in their joint statement:
					
					 Through the recent test, the DPRK showed the world that it further cemented its strategic position as a nuclear power of Juche and no force can block Songun Korea dashing toward a socialist power like the storming wind.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people closely united around Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un will win in the struggle to build a powerful socialist nation and reunify the country, under the line of simultaneously pushing forward the two fronts, an eternal banner for peace.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete dedicado a la visita de Kim Jong Il al Lejano Oriente de Rusa
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete dedicado a la visita de Kim Jong Il al Lejano Oriente de Rusa
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del aniversario 15 de la visita del Dirigente Kim Jong Il a la region del Lejano Oriente de la Federacion Rusa, el Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia ofrecieron el dia 20 en el Restaurante Okryu un banquete.
					  A la recepcion fueron invitados el embajador ruso Alexandr Matsegora y los miembros de la sede diplomatica rusa en Corea.
					
					  Y estuvieron presentes la presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jong Suk, el vicecanciller Sin Hong Chol, el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia, So Ho Won, y otros funcionarios interesados.
					
					  En el banquete hubo discursos.

articles.title: Coreanos obtienen 13 medallas de oro en 2 jornadas del campeonato de Taekwondo
articles.content:
Coreanos obtienen 13 medallas de oro en 2 jornadas del campeonato de Taekwondo
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tienen lugar en el capitalino Palacio de Taekwondo el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo.
					  En las competencias efectuadas los dias 18 y 19 los taekwondocas coreanos obtuvieron 13 medallas de oro de 36.
					
					  Actualmente, el orden de medallas de los paises son siguientes:
					
					Orden  pais   medalla de oro   la de plata   la de bronce 
					
					 1.    RPDC      13             6              2
					
					 2.    Rusia       4             9              7
					
					 3.    Ucrania     1                            4
					
					      Bulgaria     1                            4
					
					 4.   Checo                    1                5
					
					 5.   China                     1               4
					
					 6.   Inglaterra                 1                3
					
					 7.   Camboya                  1                1
					
					 8.   Estonia                                    3
					
					 9.   Bosnia-Herzegovina                          2
					
					 10.  Kazajstan                                  1
					
					      La India                                   1
					
					      Pais de Gales                               1
					
					  Continuara hasta el dia 21 el campeonato.

articles.title: Noticias de la tercera jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
articles.content:
Noticias de la tercera jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Continuan los juegos de diferentes modalidades del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do.
					Los trabajadores capitalinos de distintos sectores, los jovenes y ninos escolares, los aficionados a Taekwon-do y los huespedes extranjeros vieron los partidos del parrins, el power, las habilidades especiales y de defensa personal que tuvieron lugar el dia 20 en el Palacio de Taekwon-do.
					
					Los jugadores, quienes avanzaron a varias etapas del parrins, demostraron bien su alta capacidad fisica y tecnica aplicando diestramente las extraordinarias tacticas, metodos y habilidades de golpe. 
					
					Los espectadores vieron con admiracion los excelentes movimientos tecnicos de los taekwondocas que rompieron de un golpe los blancos instalados en distintas posiciones.
					
					Transcurrieron en una atmosfera acalorada los partidos de defensa personal.
					
					El campeonato continua.
					
					Los resultados de la segunda jornada (el dia 19) van como sigue:
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (m) de la categoria de 71kg
					
					1o lugar: Sergey Arakelyan (Rusia)
					
					2o lugar: Dmitrii Simakov (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Dmytro Vikhrov (Ucrania), Srdan Draskic (Bosnia-Herzegovina)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (m) de la categoria de 78kg
					
					1o lugar: Andrii Klymenko (Ucrania)
					
					2o lugar: Ri Song Hun (RPDC)
					
					3o lugar: Rami Shau (Bulgaria), Novak Jiri (Checo)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (m) de la categoria de 85kg
					
					1o lugar: Andrei Kress (Rusia)
					
					2o lugar: Nikita Mikhailov (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Ham Chung Ryol (RPDC), Dmytro Pilinkevych (Ucrania)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (m) de la categoria de mas de 85kg
					
					1o lugar: Nikolay Petkov (Bulgaria)
					
					2o lugar: Rim Wi Sok (RPDC)
					
					3o lugar: Denis Martsevich (Rusia), Oleksii Danshyn (Ucrania)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (f) de la categoria de 57kg
					
					1o lugar: Olga Levina (Rusia)
					
					2o lugar: Nailia Sadieva (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Kim Hyang Sim (RPDC), Albena Sitnilska (Bulgaria)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (f) de la categoria de 63kg
					
					1o lugar: Pak Mi Hyang (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Olga Gribanova (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Anastasia Kosteletskaya (Rusia), Olga Borisenko (Estonia)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (f) de la categoria de 69kg
					
					1o lugar: Sin Jong Hwa (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Ham Su Gyong (RPDC)
					
					3o lugar: Moskaleva Anastasiia (Rusia), Zhuldyz Kabdylrakhmetova (Kazajstan)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (f) de la categoria de 75kg
					
					1o lugar: Kim Su Ryon (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Kokasova Veronika (Checo)
					
					3o lugar: Natalie Christina Buchin (Inglaterra), Amy Burgess (Inglaterra)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (f) de la categoria de mas de 75kg 
					
					1o lugar: Choe Su Ryon (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Elizaveta Pronchatova (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Stekerova Tereza (Checo), Ros Sreynich (Camboya).

articles.title: Descubierta nueva tumba con pintura al fresco de la era de Coguryo
articles.content:
Descubierta nueva tumba con pintura al fresco de la era de Coguryo 
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Se ha descubierto nueva tumba con pintura al fresco de la era de Coguryo en la comuna de Posong del capitalino municipio de Rangnang.
					Es una cripta para una sola camara de ataud hecha con piedra que tiene 300 cm de longitud, 268 cm de ancho y 184 cm de altura. 
					
					El suelo de la camara de ataud esta enladrillado y repellado con cal. 
					
					La superficie de la pared hecha con piedras arregladas tambien esta repellada con cal. Se quedan todavia en las paredes nortena, oriental y occidental las pinturas al fresco en color negro.
					
					En la pared oriental se ve la columna de cabalgata en tres filas, y en la occidental, un edificio y un caballo que corre hacia el norte. 
					
					Fueron desenterrados en la tumba los articulos de adorno de oro y plata, las vasijas, los articulos decorativos hechos con hueso, etc. 
					
					La forma de estructura, las pinturas al fresco y las reliquias desenterradas demuestran que la tumba fue edificada en la primera mitad del siglo III. 
					
					Esta vez, se ha evidenciado que la pintura al fresco de la era de Coguryo se desarrollo de dibujo con lineas a la pintura monocroma y a la policroma.
